Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, and 0.0 degrees, and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, and 0.075 units. Line 1: Connecting the points (0.0, 0.0) and (0.75, 0.0) 2. Line 2: Connecting the points (0.75, 0.0) and (0.75, 0.75) 3. Line 3: Connecting the points (0.75, 0.75) and (0.0, 0.75) 4. Line 4: Connecting the points (0.0, 0.75) and (0.0, 0.0) Transforming the Sketch into 3D With the base created, we will transform it into a 3D sketch with the help of euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. This will maintain the prism's orientation in the 3D space and help with further steps. Extrude the Sketch Extrude the sketched rectangle along the Z-axis. The dimensions are as follows: - Extrude Towards Normal: 0.0375 units (half of the height) - Extrude Opposite Normal: 0.0375 units (half of the height) - Sketch Scale: 0.75 This will create a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat base and a tapering top. The height of the part will be 0.075 units, the total length shared by both width and length is 0.75 units. Continue constructing subsequent parts according to this pattern and their respective CAD Assembly JSON values. Remember to use the output shape, dimensions, and general instructions provided herein as guidance when generating each part and the final CAD model.</description>
